meanings.definition: A fire that occurs in a forest or scrubland.
meanings.sent1: The bushfire raged through the forest, destroying everything in its path.
meanings.sent2: The firefighters worked tirelessly to contain the bushfire before it spread further.
meanings.sent3: The animals in the forest had a meeting to discuss how to avoid the bushfire next time.
meanings.sent4: The bushfire of creativity burned brightly in her mind, inspiring new ideas.
meanings.sent5: The orange glow of the bushfire lit up the night sky, a mesmerizing sight.

meanings.definition: To set fire to a forest or scrubland.
meanings.sent1: He accidentally bushfired the area while trying to start a controlled burn.
meanings.sent2: The arsonist was caught red-handed trying to bushfire the national park.
meanings.sent3: She jokingly threatened to bushfire the backyard if her brother didn't clean up his mess.
meanings.sent4: His passion for music seemed to bushfire through the community, igniting a love for melodies.
meanings.sent5: The idea of change can bushfire through a stagnant environment, bringing new life and growth.
